info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 16 at 5:26AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...SLIPPERY ROAD CONDITIONS EXPECTED TO PERSIST TODAY IN MUCH OF THE MOUNTAINS OF WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA... The combination of accumulating snowfall over the past 24 hours, a light glaze of ice from freezing rain in a few spots early this morning, and falling temperatures today as colder air moves into the region will keep roads and bridges very slippery across the area today. Snow-covered roadways will persist at the higher elevations and black ice will be possible in many lower valley roadways as well. Temperatures across the region were already near or below the freezing mark at daybreak, and these will continue to fall through the daytime hours, with values in the teens likely in many spots this afternoon. Single digit low temperatures are expected tonight. If you must travel today in the western mountains of North Carolina today, allow extra travel time and use caution while driving. Be on the lookout for snow or ice covered roadways.
